result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale Mattison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.  Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale Mattison

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC-notice of court ordered financial obligations status - balance due on court ordered financial obligations $274.09.  Defendant due to discharge 02-13-2017.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.
Sentencing hearing on February 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Dale Mattison in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Cts. 1&3 - G.
BTC:  Cts. 1&3 - GUILTY.  Cts. 2&4 - DRI.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing on November 17, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Dale Mattison in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
  Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dale Mattison in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defendant has been referred to Veteran's Treatment Court.  Defense is awaiting offer. 
Defense req bond mod.
State has no objection.
BTC:  Bond mod to remove GPS and condition that no narcotics are to be taken.
  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting with atty. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 8-19-2014:  GPS CONDITION IS REMOVED.  DEFENDANT IS NOT TO TAKE ANY NARCOTIC PAIN MEDICATIONS.
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Dale Mattison in court with attorney Erin J Larsen.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.
Def- req modification of bond for GPS to be removed
BTC: Motion to modify bond denied.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Dale Mattison in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Dale Mattison in custody.  Bridget D Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
